articles.title: U.S. Scenario for Preemptive Nuclear Attack on DPRK Blasted
Wysokie Branch of Poland-Korea Association Formed
"Rally on Human Rights Issue in North" Assailed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Wysokie Branch of Poland-Korea Association Formed 
    Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- The Wysokie Branch of the Poland-Korea Association was formed with due ceremony in Wysokie on Dec. 4.
 On display in the venue of the inaugural ceremony were works of leader Kim Jong Il, photos showing his immortal Songun leadership feats and photos and printed matters dealing with the progress made by the DPRK.    
 At the ceremony the formation of the Wysokie Branch of the association was declared and Marek Smorowski was elected its chairman.
 Slaboy January Guzowski, member of the Central Committee of the Poland-Korea Association, at the ceremony referred to the originality and vitality of the Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung. He briefed its attendants on the situation on the Korean Peninsula, noting that the Korean people are pushing forward the building of a great prosperous powerful socialist nation and intensifying the struggle for Korea's reunification, while reliably guaranteeing peace and security in Northeast Asia including Korea with strong nuclear deterrent built under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.
 The members of the branch warmly congratulate the Korean people on the 14th anniversary of Kim Jong Il's assumption of office as supreme commander of the Korean People's Army and the 88th birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk, he noted. They wished the Korean people bigger success in their efforts to build a great prosperous powerful nation and accomplish the cause of national reunification under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: U.S. Brigandish Demand Rejected in S. Korea
Authorities' Unreasonable Suppression under Fire in S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S. Brigandish Demand Rejected in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification, the organization for peace against war in south Korea, reportedly held a press conference in Seoul on Dec 6 in protest against the "fifth south Korea-U.S. meeting on security policy initiative".
  The organization at the press conference charged that the U.S. seeks to realize the "strategic flexibility" of its forces present in south Korea and increase the role of the south Korea-U.S. "alliance" in return for transferring the "right to command the wartime operation" to the south Korean forces and tighten its control over them through this.    
The above-mentioned right cannot be an object of any bargaining as it is a matter pertaining to sovereignty, the organization held, declaring that it categorically rejects this U.S. brigandish demand and claim.

articles.title: DPRK's Efforts for Peaceful Reunification Supported
articles.content:
Authorities' Unreasonable Suppression under Fire in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Federation of University Student Councils reportedly issued a statement on Dec. 6 assailing the south Korean authorities for walking away students affiliated to the federation and personages from different social standings,  more than 200, for staging a surprise demonstration in front of Chongwadae on Dec. 4 and investigating them. 
 The statement termed this an anachronistic behavior of the south Korean authorities to cover up their murder of the farmer who was on protest against the opening of the rice market.    
 The federation will carry on its actions to win back all people's rights to existence, the statement noted.

articles.title: S. Korean GNP Gentries' Hooliganism under Fire
articles.content:
DPRK's Efforts for Peaceful Reunification Supported 
    Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- We most sincerely wish the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people great successes in their struggle to apply the Juche idea and step up the building of a great prosperous powerful socialist nation under the wise guidance of leader  Kim Jong Il, said General Secretary of the New Yugoslav Communist Party Branko Kitanovic and Chairman of the Workers' Party of Yugoslavia Petar Velickovic when meeting DPRK Ambassador Jo Sung Ju on Dec. 1.
 They highly praised the struggle waged by the WPK and the Korean people to build a great prosperous powerful socialist country and expressed support to their great efforts for self-reliant defence of the country.    
 Congratulating all achievements made in the DPRK, they expressed full support to its struggle to achieve independent and peaceful reunification of the country, in particular.

articles.title: Anti-DPRK Reckless Remarks of U.S. Ambassador in Seoul under Fire
Repeal of NSL Urged in S. Korea
Koreans Called upon to Advance Guided by Idea of "By Our Nation Itself"
articles.content:
Repeal of NSL Urged in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- We can no longer recognize the "National Security Law", a law dating back to the old era that diametrically runs counter to the trend of the times but demand that it be abolished. This was declared at a press conference held in front of the building of the "Kukmin Bank" in Youido, Seoul on Dec. 1 under the sponsorship of the People's Solidarity for the Abolition of the NSL in south Korea, 57 years after the fabrication of the law.
 The secretary general of the solidarity, the permanent chairman of the "National Alliance for Democracy and Reunification," the chairman of the South Headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification, the honorary chairman of the League of the Movement for National Reconciliation and other speakers said that the law has earned ill fame because it has been used as a means of opposing peace and reunification since its fabrication.
It has also been used as a political lever for promoting the interests of pro-U.S. and conservative political forces, they said, calling for abolishing the law at any cost and advancing towards the era for genuine peace, democracy and human rights.    
 "A 2005 declaration of democratic figures for the abolition of the NSL" on behalf of 6,745 of them was made public at the press conference.

articles.title: Respecting Human Rights Called for
3rd Video Meetings of Separated Families and Relatives of North and South Held
Political Advisor to Swedish PM Leaves
Greetings to President of Burkina Faso
articles.content:
Political Advisor to Swedish PM Leaves
    Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Kent Harstedt, political advisor to the Swedish Prime Minister, left here for home by air on Saturday after winding up his five-day visit to the DPRK. 
 While staying here he visited Mangyongdae and the Grand People's Study House.

articles.title: Visits
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Burkina Faso
    Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Blaise Compaore, president of Burkina Faso, on Dec. 8 on the occasion of its national day.
 The message expressed the conviction that the friendly and cooperative relations that exist between the two countries would grow stronger and sincerely wished him bigger success in his work for peace and economic progress of the country.

articles.title: FM Spokesman Blasts Virulent Outcries of U.S. Ambassador to S. Korea
articles.content:
Visits
    Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- A delegation of Kim Chaek University of Technology led by President Hong So Hon left here today to visit China and a delegation of the Korean Union of Architects led by Vice-Chairman of its Central Committee Pak Kil U to visit Mongolia.
 A delegation of the Swedish Foreign Ministry led by Ruth Jacoby arrived here today.
